figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: Distribution of the 100 articles by publication year.

figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption: Proportion of the study types. (A) proportions for different designed studies. (B) proportions for study with different evidence levels.

figure_3.title: Figure 3.
figure_3.caption: The visualized analyses of institution. (A) the top-10 institution with publications. (B) organization cooperation network.

figure_4.title: Figure 4.
figure_4.caption: Network visualization of author co-citation. Co-citation: The relatedness of items is determined based on the number of times they are cited together.

figure_5.title: Figure 5.
figure_5.caption: Information of keywords co-occurrence. (A) Keywords co-occurrence network. (B) Top-10 keywords of total link strength.

figure_6.title: Figure 6.
figure_6.caption: Top-25 keywords with the strongest citation bursts. Year, the year that a keyword was firstly cited; strength, the citation burst strength of keywords; begin and end, the duration of keywords burst.

claims.sentence: As shown in Figure 1, with a number of 11, 2011 was the most productive year for highly cited articles.

As shown in Figure 2A, there were 2 retrospective database analysis studies, 14 reviews, 18 randomized controlled trials (RCTs), 1 pilot study, 9 meta-analysis or systematic review studies, 4 guidelines, 42 cohort studies, 3 case-control studies, and 7 case reports or case series studies.
Furthermore, 73 studies had high-level evidence, whereas 27 studies had low-level evidence (Figure 2B).
The top-10 institutions of publication counts are presented in Figure 3A.
Figure 3B shows the network visualization of the organizations’ co-authorships.
The 207 organizations formed 52 clusters, and different colors represent different clusters, as shown in Figure 3B.
To better reflect the contribution and influence of author’s research, we also analyzed the co-citation of authors by VOS viewer and presented the network visualization in Figure 4.
The keywords formed six clusters and the network visualization of keywords co-occurrence is shown in Figure 5A.
The keyword with the highest appearance (31) and link strength (193) was “delirium” (Figure 5B).

The top-10 co-occurrence keywords also included “risk-factors”, “surgery”, “confusion assessment method”, “elderly patients”, “hip fracture”, “intensive care unit”, “cardiac surgery”, “general anesthesia”, and “risk” Figure 5B).
In Figure 6, 25 keywords with the highest burst strength are shown in the first column.

Open in a new tab
Information of keywords co-occurrence. (A) Keywords co-occurrence network. (B) Top-10 keywords of total link strength.Figure 6.
As shown in Figure 1, with a number of 11, 2011 was the most productive year for highly cited articles.

As shown in Figure 2A, there were 2 retrospective database analysis studies, 14 reviews, 18 randomized controlled trials (RCTs), 1 pilot study, 9 meta-analysis or systematic review studies, 4 guidelines, 42 cohort studies, 3 case-control studies, and 7 case reports or case series studies.
Furthermore, 73 studies had high-level evidence, whereas 27 studies had low-level evidence (Figure 2B).
The top-10 institutions of publication counts are presented in Figure 3A.
Figure 3B shows the network visualization of the organizations’ co-authorships.
The 207 organizations formed 52 clusters, and different colors represent different clusters, as shown in Figure 3B.
To better reflect the contribution and influence of author’s research, we also analyzed the co-citation of authors by VOS viewer and presented the network visualization in Figure 4.
The keywords formed six clusters and the network visualization of keywords co-occurrence is shown in Figure 5A.
The keyword with the highest appearance (31) and link strength (193) was “delirium” (Figure 5B).

The top-10 co-occurrence keywords also included “risk-factors”, “surgery”, “confusion assessment method”, “elderly patients”, “hip fracture”, “intensive care unit”, “cardiac surgery”, “general anesthesia”, and “risk” Figure 5B).
In Figure 6, 25 keywords with the highest burst strength are shown in the first column.

Figure 3B shows the network visualization of the organizations’ co-authorships.

To better reflect the contribution and influence of author’s research, we also analyzed the co-citation of authors by VOS viewer and presented the network visualization in Figure 4.
